Plot Code Saturation

Source: R/plot_saturation.R
plot_saturation.Rd

plot_saturation() creates a bar chart of codes that meet saturation thresholds defined by set_saturation(). Bars represent code counts, and the fill color indicates the proportion of media titles in which each code appears.

Usage

plot_saturation(saturation_df, sort_by = c("count", "prop_media_titles"))

Arguments

saturation_df

A tibble returned by set_saturation() containing columns code, count, and prop_media_titles.

sort_by

Whether to sort codes by "count" or by "prop_media_titles" (default = "count").

Value

A ggplot2 object showing a horizontal bar plot of code counts, with fill color corresponding to the proportion of media titles.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
library(readxl)
library(dplyr)
library(tidyverse)

# Load excerpts and clean
excerpts <- read_xlsx("inst/raw_data/test_data.xlsx")
preferred_coders <- c("a", "l", "i", "r", "s", "v", "c", "n", "k")
excerpts <- clean_data(excerpts, preferred_coders)

# Count codes
code_counts <- count_codes(excerpts, min_count = 10, output = "tibble")

# Apply saturation filter
saturation <- set_saturation(code_counts, min_count = 10, min_prop_media_titles = 0.25)

# Plot results
plot_saturation(saturation, sort_by = "count")
} # }
